performances.description: Insane rager, hold on to your seats

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Classic pigpen

performances.venue: Yale Bowl, Yale University New Haven, CT
performances.description: Played a week before the 8/6/71 version, but super hot also.  Both versions are a part of Road Trips Vol1-3.
Not sure why the next night gets all the love, this one's great, too!
When I'm a little hard to handle I load this up and pull the trigger. I'm surprised no one submitted this one yet.
Starts off with Pigpen improving lyrics then Bobby and Jerry battle off each other beautifully.  Give it a listen!!
The Bear's Choice version.
Oh Yeah!!

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Possibly the best out of this Fillmore East run..listen to the boys explode during the jam, an 8/6/71 contender
Phil just likes doin' the nasty all over this one! The mix is fooked but well worth the listen for the JAM - dang!
Pigpen's voice is deep, SC-soaked and clear.  The jam is ballsy and pushing out against the seams.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
Fillmore East (Late Show) New York, NY
performances.description: Certainly not number one, but worthy to be listed.
Fantastic early H2H when Jer was still rippin' it with the slide!
Another great version from August.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Bobby Weir on de Funky Riddim Guitar - stellar!
Pretty in your face guitar work by Jerry.  Real nice Dave's pick.
Last one with Pig: A blasting sexy swagger with slow rising force like the Palladium one up top here. Listen past the tape problems and slow start.

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York City, NY
performances.description: Not as long as they'd become but the jamming is intense
That great May 1970 Jerry tone. Electric.

performances.venue: Terminal Island Correctional Facility San Pedro, CA
performances.description: Home of The Bear...energized to say the least

performances.venue: Lusk Field House - State University Of New York Cortland, NY
performances.description: Overlooked gritty superfunk. Bobby solos, then Jerry takes him to school. Phil, meanwhile is nuking the world big time.
Of course. Every April'71 is outta sight, and this one pumps diesel.
A tight, solid version that just grabs yer ass and shakes it for ya!
wow
Classic "single" version, meaning shorter and more compact than the '71 hyperspace megas.

performances.venue: Seminole Indian Village West Hollywood, FL
performances.description: Primal grateful dead at the Seminole Indian village
Listening to this got my speakers pregnant.
Etta James...This is a great version of a great song.
One HARD Hard to Handle!
Cruising along with 3rd° swagger when it suddently hits high gear and <BOOM!>, you become the Pig, and it feels good.

performances.venue: Davis Gym, Bucknell University Lewisburg, PA
performances.description: Another raging inferno. Benefits enormously from a great mix where everyone's audible and you hear Bobby's part. Hot stuff.
Probably the best 'Bobby Segment' on this tune that I've heard, and Pig at his greasy best.
Short but filled with energy

performances.venue: East Hall, Franklin & Marshall College Lancaster, PA
performances.description: Such an awesome rendition. Slow and low is the tempo.  Phil is epic in this version!
Hot sex.

performances.venue: School Gymnasium, S.U.N.Y. Stony Brook, NY
performances.description: Super tight and funky
Crazy slide licks, wondeful version from a show with one of the best second sets of all time! Jerry goes nuts a little over 3 minutes in . . .
My first bootleg ever, this song took me on this long strange trip.  Phil's bass lines are phat and enjoyable.  A personal favorite!!
Love this show and this version does not disappoint
Muscular vintage riffing...
Psychedelic Slide Jammin.
Such a relaxed smoking informal show, the crowd and band are interacting throughout and the music is magical
This is the first Hard to handle since August 26, 1971. Thanks to Etta James Vocals

performances.venue: Wallace Wade Stadium, Duke University Durham, NC
performances.description: A song that was generally performed at an exceptional level throughout 1971 this is no exception.
jerry feels it
Tight, sweet version. Doesn't have the inferno element from some at the top, but a strong one nevertheless.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: "How was this not here" is a thing I read a lot on here. The saying is def true with this HOT 6+ min version. Pig is S C R E A M I N G ! ! !
Pig clear in the mix with JG delivering the funky blues chops you wanna hear.

performances.venue: University of Iowa Iowa City, IA
performances.description: Hot and sweaty sounding mix with a bit of a slow burn from Jerry - not crazy with the macho but cool.
Nawlins Rockin'
Macho and Jammy right here.

performances.venue: Camp Randall Field House Madison, WI
performances.description: A fantastic version from a fantastic show!
Pig on the scene.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Unique flavor to this one, with Steve Winwood poaching Pig's organ.
Hate to be that guy... But can't believe this one isn't here, best of 1970? It's on youtube. Type in 'Grateful Dead Hard to Handle 1970'

performances.venue: Ungano's Night Club New York, NY
performances.description: Date overshadowed by the next night and ambiguous provenance - but don't skip it. Bobby's high in the mix with rare balance and a great jam.
Pigpen struggles with his timing and vocals in general.
I love the hard chargers, but this one is different: Almost mellow with a slow simmering groove. Cool, not hot. Check it out.
More like the great '71s than the others from 1970.  A hard enough rocker that it apparently nuked Phil's amp, leading to a wonderful acoustic set.
absolutley rocks versions like this are why the black crowes chose to do this song
Tis is fantastic Pigpen in full display of his powers
JG throws down all sorts of slide weirdness here.
Another great 1969 Version with Pigpen leading the band in its blues psychedelia period.
Super smooth Quaalude styled jam that is totally worth the trip.
Famous Black and White Ball

performances.venue: Freeborn Hall, University of California Davis, CA
performances.description: Completely overlooked UC Davis show that exists only on an aud. But this version smokes.

performances.venue: McDonough Arena - Georgetown University Washington, DC
performances.description: Begins sounding like the epic hard charging beast it becomes over the next months.

performances.venue: Santa Rosa Fairgrounds Santa Rosa, CA
performances.description: Hot Licks city ala 1970
Hot soloing and '71 levels of intensity.  Listenable in spite of some tape wobble and distortion. Fun to watch H2H expanding during this era.
Great 'Bobby segment', as his solo has come to be known. Whole show overshadowed by the outrageous monster the next day, but still great fun.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Nice slower version. Jerry solo and band improv a little different than usual.
Solid version, deserves a listen for sure.
Is everybody ready to boogie?!?
Don't pass this by because of the AUD issues. Stands up to all the top H2Hs here. The jam and energy are outrageous.
Real heady performance of the classic pigpen number
Hot Pigpen with the band just ripping
full of tons of high energy with a unique Pigpen rap. real hot.
Pigpen is dominating the proceedings this evening
sweet hard to handle opener, hot barn burner, pigpen in fine form
Great early version - nice jam.
Sweet Hrd to Handle show plaqued with equipment problems but the boys give their all throughout

performances.venue: McArthur Court, University of Oregon Eugene, OR
performances.description: fantastic version so many heady moments in 1969
A hot version! T.C is a huge part of this one. Some real feisty organ textures all throughout, particularly toward the beginning and end of the jam.
Jerry just never takes the slide off from It Hurts Me Too, makes me smile hearing him work his way through this tune. Definitely a lysergic night.
While the recording isn't great, you can still hear and feel the intensity. Really great and worth checking out
AUD only but fire! Not totally smoking but its heady for sure. The Dead opening for Hendrix can't get any better than that
Real hot one!

performances.venue: NY State Pavilion, Flushing Meadow Park Queens, NY
performances.description: With Jerry on Pedal Steel. Excellent version from an underrated show. Terriffic, one of the earliest cowboy sounding shows.
Swanky, loose and dirty.
Not too slow, bouncy, Pig confident, on his best game, and sounds like he wants to be there. Jam starting at 3:00 is a sonic gumbo.
This version is pretty unique and excellent. .
Short but just as hot as always!
The only recording available, it starts in the middle of the instrumental break.
Awesome show opener

performances.venue: University Auditorium, University of Arizona Tucson, AZ
performances.description: Great Jam with Pigpen leading the charge, controlling the mic like an mc pigpen emoting his swagger on this version, HOT!!!!
Sick fast short early hard to handle good little jam
